comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Version number is not 0.0.1, 0.1.0, or 1.0.0
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: CSV, DataFrames. You may find [CompatHelper](https://github.com/bcbi/CompatHelper.jl) helpful for keeping your compat entries up-to-date.Note: If your package works for the current version `x.y.z` of a dependency `foo`, then a compat entry `foo = x.y.z` implies a compatibility upper bound for packages following semver. You can additionally include earlier versions your package is compatible with. See https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/ for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

@flare9x Yep now just leave it the way it is. This PR can be manually merged after the three-day waiting period for new packages.

[noblock]

```
┌ Info: Standard initial version number 
│   meets_this_guideline = false
└   message = "Version number is not 0.0.1, 0.1.0, or 1.0.0"
┌ Info: Repo URL ends with /name.jl.git
│   meets_this_guideline = true
└   message = ""
┌ Info: Compat (with upper bound) for all dependencies
│   meets_this_guideline = true
└   message = ""
```

Ok thanks - upper bound Compat worked out.
